title: Afghanistan’s Main Military Hospital Hit by Two Explosions, Gunfire
sub_head: Kabul hospital treats injured Taliban fighters and former Afghan republic soldiers alike
body:
KABUL—Afghanistan’s main military hospital, now housing injured Taliban fighters and veterans of the former Afghan military, came under attack on Tuesday, in the latest eruption of violence since the Islamist movement seized power mid-August.
A powerful explosion at the entrance to the hospital, in Kabul’s Wazir Akbar Khan area, was heard throughout the Afghan capital. It was followed by an exchange of gunfire, and another blast several minutes later. There was no immediate information on the extent of casualties.
